data.title: Isabella of Angouleme
data.meta_description: The historical second wife of King John of England who was established as the main antagonist in the Robin Hood stories by Howard Pyle in his 1883 book The Merry Adventures of Robin Hood where John's characterization is heavily influenced by his portrayal in Sir Walter Scott's Ivanhoe. Her...
data.text:
Origin[]

The historical second wife of King John of England who was established as the main antagonist in the Robin Hood stories by Howard Pyle in his 1883 book The Merry Adventures of Robin Hood where John's characterization is heavily influenced by his portrayal in Sir Walter Scott's Ivanhoe.

In Robin Hood[]

Her inclusion in tales concerning the outlaw folk hero is a modern development in the stories.

Historical Figure[]
